popups.title: Launch: October 13, 2023
popups.description: Psyche was launched at Kennedy Space Center on a Falcon Heavy rocket.

popups.title: Gravity Assist: 2026
popups.description: NASA plans to have Psyche do a gracity assist maneuver at Mars in 2026.  This will make it so it will reach the asteroid in 2029.

popups.title: Orbit A
popups.description: Orbit A is the 1st orbit phase and the lowest orbit in the mission. This orbit will last 56 days where Psyche will enter a 700km orbit for magnetic field characterization and preliminary mapping.

popups.title: Orbit B1
popups.description: Orbist B1 is the 2nd orbit phase and is below Orbit A.  Psyche will descend from orbit A into orbit B1 at 303km.  This will last for 92 days with the goal of topopgraphy and magentic filed characterization.

popups.title: Orbit D
popups.description: Orbit D is the 3rd orbit phase and the lowest orbit in the mission.  It will allow for a direct view of the asteroikd equator and utilize the gamma-ray and neutron spectrometers to determine the chemical composition of the asteroid.

popups.title: Orbit C
popups.description: Orbit C is the 4th orbit and is above orbit D at 75km.  Orbit C will last for 100 day in order to perform gravity investigation and more magnetic field observations.

popups.title: Orbit B2
popups.description: Orbit B2 is the last orbit and is the same as orbit B1.  It will last for 100 days in order to finish the mapping of the asteroid.

popups.title: End of Mission
popups.description: Psyche is expected to end in November 2031 where it will be left to orbit the asteroid.
